title: Two blocks connected by a lightweight rope

content.question: Two identical blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> are connected by a lightweight rope. Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is pulled to the right by a constant force <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The blocks are moving to the right across a rough surface and approach point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, where the rough surface transitions to a surface with negligible friction. How does the tension, <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math>, in the rope connecting the blocks change, if at all, as block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> passes point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>?

choices.label: The change in <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> cannot be determined without knowing the coefficient of friction and the mass of the blocks.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
